title: Sine and Cosine Function - simultaneous behavior

content.question: ​The functions <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are given by <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals cos theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="g open parentheses theta close parentheses equals sin theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. On which of the following intervals are both <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> increasing?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="0 less than theta less than pi over 2"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="pi over 2 less than theta less than pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="pi less than theta less than fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction less than theta less than 2 pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction less than theta less than 2 pi"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
